title: Frequently Asked Questions
description: Find answers to common questions about Play Serve - your tennis community app

questions.question: How do I join a tennis club?
questions.answer: Browse available clubs in the Clubs tab, tap on a club to view details, then tap 'Join This Club' to become a member. You'll need to be signed in to join clubs.

questions.question: Do I need to pay to use Play Serve?
questions.answer: Play Serve is free to use! There are no subscription fees or hidden charges. Individual clubs may have their own membership fees, which are separate from the app.

questions.question: Can I join multiple clubs?
questions.answer: Yes! You can join as many clubs as you'd like. This is great if you play at different locations or want to connect with various tennis communities.

questions.question: How do I find someone to play with?
questions.answer:
There are several ways:
• Check 'Open Invites' in your club to see who's looking for matches
• Use 'Schedule a Match' to create your own invite
• View club rankings to find players at your skill level
• Connect with players after recording matches together

questions.question: What's the difference between 'Record Match' and 'Schedule a Match'?
questions.answer:
• 'Record Match': For logging a match you've already played
• 'Schedule a Match': For posting an open invite to find players for future matches

questions.question: How do open invites work?
questions.answer: When you schedule a match, it creates an open invite visible to all club members. Other players can accept your invite, and you'll be notified when someone wants to play. Invites expire after 7 days.

questions.question: Can I play singles and doubles?
questions.answer: Yes! Play Serve supports both singles and doubles matches. When recording or scheduling a match, you can specify the format you want to play.

questions.question: How do I find members in my club?
questions.answer: Use the Members tab in any club to browse all club members. You can sort and filter members to find ideal playing partners based on your preferences.

questions.question: What are the sorting options in the Members tab?
questions.answer:
You can sort club members by:
• **Name**: Alphabetical order (A-Z)
• **Wins**: Most wins first (great for finding competitive players)
• **Matches**: Most active players first (members who play frequently)
• **Recent**: Recently joined members first (newest members)

questions.question: What are the filter options in the Members tab?
questions.answer:
You can filter club members by activity level:
• **All**: Shows every club member
• **Active**: Shows members with 3+ matches played (experienced, regular players)
• **New**: Shows members who joined in the last 30 days (great for welcoming newcomers)

Active members have an 'ACTIVE' badge, and new members have a 'NEW' badge for easy identification.

questions.question: What do the member statistics show?
questions.answer:
Each member's card displays:
• **Total matches played** in this club
• **Total wins** in this club
• **Win rate percentage** calculated from their match history
• **Color-coded progress bar**: Green (60%+ win rate), Orange (40-59%), Red (<40%)
• **Join date** when they became a club member

This helps you find players at your skill level or playing style preference.

questions.question: How do I filter matches in the Matches tab?
questions.answer:
The Matches tab provides simple filtering options:
• **Type**: Filter by match format (All, Singles, or Doubles)
• **Date**: Filter by time period (All Time, Last Week, or Last Month)

These filters help you quickly find specific matches or review recent club activity.

questions.question: How do rankings work?
questions.answer:
Play Serve uses an advanced ELO rating system that considers both WHO you beat and HOW you beat them:

**Starting Rating**: Everyone begins at 1200 points

**Opponent Strength Matters**:
• **Beat a stronger player**: Gain more points (up to +40)
• **Beat a similar player**: Gain moderate points (+20)
• **Beat a weaker player**: Gain fewer points (+5 minimum)

**Match Scores Matter Too**:
• **Dominant win (6-0, 6-1)**: Get 150% of normal points
• **Strong win (6-2, 6-3)**: Get 125% of normal points
• **Solid win (6-4, 6-4)**: Get 110% of normal points
• **Close win (7-6, 7-6)**: Get only 75% of normal points

**Example**: Beat a stronger player 6-0, 6-1? You might gain +52 points! Win the same match 7-6, 7-6? You'd only gain +26 points.

This rewards not just winning, but winning convincingly!

questions.question: Why does beating stronger players give more points?
questions.answer:
The ELO system rewards competitive challenges:
• It encourages players to challenge those above their level
• Prevents 'farming' easy wins against weaker players
• Creates accurate skill-based rankings
• Makes upsets exciting and rewarding

The bigger the rating gap, the more points at stake!

questions.question: What happens to my ranking if I don't play for a while?
questions.answer:
Your ELO rating stays the same when inactive - you don't lose points for not playing. However:
• Active players may pass you in the rankings
• Your first few games back use a higher 'K-factor' for bigger adjustments
• This helps your rating quickly adjust if your skill has changed

questions.question: Are singles and doubles ranked separately?
questions.answer:
Currently, both singles and doubles affect your overall ELO rating:
• Singles matches have full impact on your rating
• Doubles matches have 50% impact (since wins are shared)
• This gives you one unified club ranking across all play

questions.question: What do the rating tiers mean?
questions.answer:
Players are grouped into skill tiers based on ELO rating:

• **Elite** (1600+): Top competitive players 🏆
• **Advanced** (1400-1599): Strong club players 🥈
• **Intermediate** (1200-1399): Average club players 🥉
• **Beginner** (1000-1199): Developing players 🌱
• **New Player** (<1000): Just starting out 🎾

New players with fewer than 10 matches see larger rating changes as the system learns their skill level.

questions.question: What are the community standards?
questions.answer:
• Be respectful to all players
• Show up for scheduled matches
• Record scores honestly
• Maintain good sportsmanship
• Keep club facilities clean
• Follow individual club rules

questions.question: What if someone doesn't show up for a scheduled match?
questions.answer: If a player repeatedly no-shows, report this to club administrators. Clubs may have their own policies for handling no-shows.

questions.question: Can I dispute a match result?
questions.answer: If there's a disagreement about scores, try to resolve it with the other player first. For persistent issues, contact your club administrator for assistance.

questions.question: Who can see my profile information?
questions.answer:
• Your name and stats are visible to members of clubs you've joined
• Your email remains private
• Match history is visible to club members
• You control what information you add to your profile

questions.question: Is my location tracked?
questions.answer: Location is only used when you explicitly allow it to find nearby clubs. We don't track or store your location continuously.

questions.question: How do I report inappropriate behavior?
questions.answer: Contact your club administrator for club-specific issues. For app-wide concerns or serious violations, email support@caritos.com

questions.question: The app isn't working properly. What should I do?
questions.answer:
Try these steps:
1. Force close and restart the app
2. Check your internet connection
3. Update to the latest app version
4. Sign out and sign back in

If issues persist, email support@caritos.com

questions.question: How do I delete my account?
questions.answer: To delete your account, email support@caritos.com from your registered email address. Note that this will permanently remove all your data, including match history and rankings.

questions.question: Can I use Play Serve on multiple devices?
questions.answer: Yes! Sign in with the same account on any device to access your profile, clubs, and match history.
